  16. (* NOTE:
  17.    If this file is stringLabels.mli, run tools/sync_stdlib_docs after editing
  18.    it to generate string.mli.

  20.    If this file is string.mli, do not edit it directly -- edit
  21.    stringLabels.mli instead.
  22. *)

  24. (** Strings.

  26.     A string [s] of length [n] is an indexable and immutable sequence
  27.     of [n] bytes. For historical reasons these bytes are referred to
  28.     as characters.

  30.     The semantics of string functions is defined in terms of
  31.     indices and positions. These are depicted and described
  32.     as follows.

  34. {v
  35. positions  0   1   2   3   4    n-1    n
  36.            +---+---+---+---+     +-----+
  37.   indices  | 0 | 1 | 2 | 3 | ... | n-1 |
  38.            +---+---+---+---+     +-----+
  39. v}
  40.     {ul
  41.     {- An {e index} [i] of [s] is an integer in the range \[[0];[n-1]\].
  42.        It represents the [i]th byte (character) of [s] which can be
  43.        accessed using the constant time string indexing operator
  44.        [s.[i]].}
  45.     {- A {e position} [i] of [s] is an integer in the range
  46.        \[[0];[n]\]. It represents either the point at the beginning of
  47.        the string, or the point between two indices, or the point at
  48.        the end of the string. The [i]th byte index is between position
  49.        [i] and [i+1].}}

  51.     Two integers [start] and [len] are said to define a {e valid
  52.     substring} of [s] if [len >= 0] and [start], [start+len] are
  53.     positions of [s].

  55.     {b Unicode text.} Strings being arbitrary sequences of bytes, they
  56.     can hold any kind of textual encoding. However the recommended
  57.     encoding for storing Unicode text in OCaml strings is UTF-8. This
  58.     is the encoding used by Unicode escapes in string literals. For
  59.     example the string ["\u{1F42B}"] is the UTF-8 encoding of the
  60.     Unicode character U+1F42B.

  62.     {b Past mutability.} Before OCaml 4.02, strings used to be modifiable in
  63.     place like {!Bytes.t} mutable sequences of bytes.
  64.     OCaml 4 had various compiler flags and configuration options to support the
  65.     transition period from mutable to immutable strings.
  66.     Those options are no longer available, and strings are now always
  67.     immutable.

  69.     The labeled version of this module can be used as described in the
  70.     {!StdLabels} module.
  71. *)

  73. (** {1:strings Strings} *)

  75. ‌type t = string
  76. (** The type for strings. *)

  78. ‌val make : int -> char -> string
  79. (** [make n c] is a string of length [n] with each index holding the
  80.     character [c].

  82.     @raise Invalid_argument if [n < 0] or [n > ]{!Sys.max_string_length}. *)

  84. ‌val init : int -> f:(int -> char) -> string
  85. (** [init n ~f] is a string of length [n] with index
  86.     [i] holding the character [f i] (called in increasing index order).

  88.     @raise Invalid_argument if [n < 0] or [n > ]{!Sys.max_string_length}.
  89.     @since 4.02 *)

  91. ‌val empty : string
  92. (** The empty string.

  94.     @since 4.13
  95. *)

  97. external length : string -> int = "%string_length"
  98. (** [length s] is the length (number of bytes/characters) of [s]. *)

  100. external get : string -> int -> char = "%string_safe_get"
  101. (** [get s i] is the character at index [i] in [s]. This is the same
  102.     as writing [s.[i]].

  104.     @raise Invalid_argument if [i] not an index of [s]. *)

  106. val of_bytes : bytes -> string
  107. (** Return a new string that contains the same bytes as the given byte
  108.     sequence.

  110.     @since 4.13
  111. *)

  113. val to_bytes : string -> bytes
  114. (** Return a new byte sequence that contains the same bytes as the given
  115.     string.

  117.     @since 4.13
  118. *)

  120. val blit :
  121.   src:string -> src_pos:int -> dst:bytes -> dst_pos:int -> len:int -> unit
  122. (** Same as {!Bytes.blit_string} which should be preferred. *)

  124. (** {1:concat Concatenating}

  126.     {b Note.} The {!Stdlib.( ^ )} binary operator concatenates two
  127.     strings. *)

  129. val concat : sep:string -> string list -> string
  130. (** [concat ~sep ss] concatenates the list of strings [ss], inserting
  131.     the separator string [sep] between each.

  133.     @raise Invalid_argument if the result is longer than
  134.     {!Sys.max_string_length} bytes. *)

  136. val cat : string -> string -> string
  137. (** [cat s1 s2] concatenates s1 and s2 ([s1 ^ s2]).

  139.     @raise Invalid_argument if the result is longer than
  140.     {!Sys.max_string_length} bytes.

  142.     @since 4.13
  143. *)

  145. (** {1:predicates Predicates and comparisons} *)

  147. val equal : t -> t -> bool
  148. (** [equal s0 s1] is [true] if and only if [s0] and [s1] are character-wise
  149.     equal.
  150.     @since 4.03 (4.05 in StringLabels) *)

  152. val compare : t -> t -> int
  153. (** [compare s0 s1] sorts [s0] and [s1] in lexicographical order. [compare]
  154.     behaves like {!Stdlib.compare} on strings but may be more efficient. *)

  156. val starts_with :
  157.   prefix (* comment thwarts tools/sync_stdlib_docs *) :string -> string -> bool
  158. (** [starts_with ][~prefix s] is [true] if and only if [s] starts with
  159.     [prefix].

  161.     @since 4.13 *)

  163. val ends_with :
  164.   suffix (* comment thwarts tools/sync_stdlib_docs *) :string -> string -> bool
  165. (** [ends_with ][~suffix s] is [true] if and only if [s] ends with [suffix].

  167.     @since 4.13 *)

  169. val contains_from : string -> int -> char -> bool
  170. (** [contains_from s start c] is [true] if and only if [c] appears in [s]
  171.     after position [start].

  173.     @raise Invalid_argument if [start] is not a valid position in [s]. *)

  175. val rcontains_from : string -> int -> char -> bool
  176. (** [rcontains_from s stop c] is [true] if and only if [c] appears in [s]
  177.     before position [stop+1].

  179.     @raise Invalid_argument if [stop < 0] or [stop+1] is not a valid
  180.     position in [s]. *)

  182. val contains : string -> char -> bool
  183. (** [contains s c] is {!String.contains_from}[ s 0 c]. *)

  185. (** {1:extract Extracting substrings} *)

  187. val sub : string -> pos:int -> len:int -> string
  188. (** [sub s ~pos ~len] is a string of length [len], containing the
  189.     substring of [s] that starts at position [pos] and has length
  190.     [len].

  192.     @raise Invalid_argument if [pos] and [len] do not designate a valid
  193.     substring of [s]. *)

  195. val split_on_char : sep:char -> string -> string list
  196. (** [split_on_char ~sep s] is the list of all (possibly empty)
  197.     substrings of [s] that are delimited by the character [sep].

  199.     The function's result is specified by the following invariants:
  200.     {ul
  201.     {- The list is not empty.}
  202.     {- Concatenating its elements using [sep] as a separator returns a
  203.       string equal to the input ([concat (make 1 sep)
  204.       (split_on_char sep s) = s]).}
  205.     {- No string in the result contains the [sep] character.}}

  207.     @since 4.04 (4.05 in StringLabels) *)

  209. (** {1:transforming Transforming} *)

  211. val map : f:(char -> char) -> string -> string
  212. (** [map f s] is the string resulting from applying [f] to all the
  213.     characters of [s] in increasing order.

  215.     @since 4.00 *)

  217. val mapi : f:(int -> char -> char) -> string -> string
  218. (** [mapi ~f s] is like {!map} but the index of the character is also
  219.     passed to [f].

  221.     @since 4.02 *)

  223. val fold_left : f:('acc -> char -> 'acc) -> init:'acc -> string -> 'acc
  224. (** [fold_left f x s] computes [f (... (f (f x s.[0]) s.[1]) ...) s.[n-1]],
  225.     where [n] is the length of the string [s].
  226.     @since 4.13 *)

  228. val fold_right : f:(char -> 'acc -> 'acc) -> string -> init:'acc -> 'acc
  229. (** [fold_right f s x] computes [f s.[0] (f s.[1] ( ... (f s.[n-1] x) ...))],
  230.     where [n] is the length of the string [s].
  231.     @since 4.13 *)

  233. val for_all : f:(char -> bool) -> string -> bool
  234. (** [for_all p s] checks if all characters in [s] satisfy the predicate [p].
  235.     @since 4.13 *)

  237. val exists : f:(char -> bool) -> string -> bool
  238. (** [exists p s] checks if at least one character of [s] satisfies the predicate
  239.     [p].
  240.     @since 4.13 *)

  242. val trim : string -> string
  243. (** [trim s] is [s] without leading and trailing whitespace. Whitespace
  244.     characters are: [' '], ['\x0C'] (form feed), ['\n'], ['\r'], and ['\t'].

  246.     @since 4.00 *)

  248. val escaped : string -> string
  249. (** [escaped s] is [s] with special characters represented by escape
  250.     sequences, following the lexical conventions of OCaml.

  252.     All characters outside the US-ASCII printable range \[0x20;0x7E\] are
  253.     escaped, as well as backslash (0x2F) and double-quote (0x22).

  255.     The function {!Scanf.unescaped} is a left inverse of [escaped],
  256.     i.e. [Scanf.unescaped (escaped s) = s] for any string [s] (unless
  257.     [escaped s] fails).

  259.     @raise Invalid_argument if the result is longer than
  260.     {!Sys.max_string_length} bytes. *)

  262. val uppercase_ascii : string -> string
  263. (** [uppercase_ascii s] is [s] with all lowercase letters
  264.     translated to uppercase, using the US-ASCII character set.

  266.     @since 4.03 (4.05 in StringLabels) *)

  268. val lowercase_ascii : string -> string
  269. (** [lowercase_ascii s] is [s] with all uppercase letters translated
  270.     to lowercase, using the US-ASCII character set.

  272.     @since 4.03 (4.05 in StringLabels) *)

  274. val capitalize_ascii : string -> string
  275. (** [capitalize_ascii s] is [s] with the first character set to
  276.     uppercase, using the US-ASCII character set.

  278.     @since 4.03 (4.05 in StringLabels) *)

  280. val uncapitalize_ascii : string -> string
  281. (** [uncapitalize_ascii s] is [s] with the first character set to lowercase,
  282.     using the US-ASCII character set.

  284.     @since 4.03 (4.05 in StringLabels) *)

  286. (** {1:traversing Traversing} *)

  288. val iter : f:(char -> unit) -> string -> unit
  289. (** [iter ~f s] applies function [f] in turn to all the characters of [s].
  290.     It is equivalent to [f s.[0]; f s.[1]; ...; f s.[length s - 1]; ()]. *)

  292. val iteri : f:(int -> char -> unit) -> string -> unit
  293. (** [iteri] is like {!iter}, but the function is also given the
  294.     corresponding character index.

  296.     @since 4.00 *)

  298. (** {1:searching Searching} *)

  300. val index_from : string -> int -> char -> int
  301. (** [index_from s i c] is the index of the first occurrence of [c] in
  302.     [s] after position [i].

  304.     @raise Not_found if [c] does not occur in [s] after position [i].
  305.     @raise Invalid_argument if [i] is not a valid position in [s]. *)


  308. val index_from_opt : string -> int -> char -> int option
  309. (** [index_from_opt s i c] is the index of the first occurrence of [c]
  310.     in [s] after position [i] (if any).

  312.     @raise Invalid_argument if [i] is not a valid position in [s].
  313.     @since 4.05 *)

  315. val rindex_from : string -> int -> char -> int
  316. (** [rindex_from s i c] is the index of the last occurrence of [c] in
  317.     [s] before position [i+1].

  319.     @raise Not_found if [c] does not occur in [s] before position [i+1].
  320.     @raise Invalid_argument if [i+1] is not a valid position in [s]. *)

  322. val rindex_from_opt : string -> int -> char -> int option
  323. (** [rindex_from_opt s i c] is the index of the last occurrence of [c]
  324.     in [s] before position [i+1] (if any).

  326.     @raise Invalid_argument if [i+1] is not a valid position in [s].
  327.     @since 4.05 *)

  329. val index : string -> char -> int
  330. (** [index s c] is {!String.index_from}[ s 0 c]. *)

  332. val index_opt : string -> char -> int option
  333. (** [index_opt s c] is {!String.index_from_opt}[ s 0 c].

  335.     @since 4.05 *)

  337. val rindex : string -> char -> int
  338. (** [rindex s c] is {!String.rindex_from}[ s (length s - 1) c]. *)

  340. val rindex_opt : string -> char -> int option
  341. (** [rindex_opt s c] is {!String.rindex_from_opt}[ s (length s - 1) c].

  343.     @since 4.05 *)

  345. (** {1 Strings and Sequences} *)

  347. val to_seq : t -> char Seq.t
  348. (** [to_seq s] is a sequence made of the string's characters in
  349.     increasing order. In ["unsafe-string"] mode, modifications of the string
  350.     during iteration will be reflected in the sequence.

  352.     @since 4.07 *)

  354. val to_seqi : t -> (int * char) Seq.t
  355. (** [to_seqi s] is like {!to_seq} but also tuples the corresponding index.

  357.     @since 4.07 *)

  359. val of_seq : char Seq.t -> t
  360. (** [of_seq s] is a string made of the sequence's characters.

  362.     @since 4.07 *)

  364. (** {1:utf UTF decoding and validations}

  366.     @since 4.14 *)

  368. (** {2:utf_8 UTF-8} *)

  370. val get_utf_8_uchar : t -> int -> Uchar.utf_decode
  371. (** [get_utf_8_uchar b i] decodes an UTF-8 character at index [i] in
  372.     [b]. *)

  374. val is_valid_utf_8 : t -> bool
  375. (** [is_valid_utf_8 b] is [true] if and only if [b] contains valid
  376.     UTF-8 data. *)

  378. (** {2:utf_16be UTF-16BE} *)

  380. val get_utf_16be_uchar : t -> int -> Uchar.utf_decode
  381. (** [get_utf_16be_uchar b i] decodes an UTF-16BE character at index
  382.     [i] in [b]. *)

  384. val is_valid_utf_16be : t -> bool
  385. (** [is_valid_utf_16be b] is [true] if and only if [b] contains valid
  386.     UTF-16BE data. *)

  388. (** {2:utf_16le UTF-16LE} *)

  390. val get_utf_16le_uchar : t -> int -> Uchar.utf_decode
  391. (** [get_utf_16le_uchar b i] decodes an UTF-16LE character at index
  392.     [i] in [b]. *)

  394. val is_valid_utf_16le : t -> bool
  395. (** [is_valid_utf_16le b] is [true] if and only if [b] contains valid
  396.     UTF-16LE data. *)

  398. (** {1 Binary decoding of integers} *)

  400. (** The functions in this section binary decode integers from strings.

  402.     All following functions raise [Invalid_argument] if the characters
  403.     needed at index [i] to decode the integer are not available.

  405.     Little-endian (resp. big-endian) encoding means that least
  406.     (resp. most) significant bytes are stored first.  Big-endian is
  407.     also known as network byte order.  Native-endian encoding is
  408.     either little-endian or big-endian depending on {!Sys.big_endian}.

  410.     32-bit and 64-bit integers are represented by the [int32] and
  411.     [int64] types, which can be interpreted either as signed or
  412.     unsigned numbers.

  414.     8-bit and 16-bit integers are represented by the [int] type,
  415.     which has more bits than the binary encoding.  These extra bits
  416.     are sign-extended (or zero-extended) for functions which decode 8-bit
  417.     or 16-bit integers and represented them with [int] values.
  418. *)

  420. val get_uint8 : string -> int -> int
  421. (** [get_uint8 b i] is [b]'s unsigned 8-bit integer starting at character
  422.     index [i].

  424.     @since 4.13
  425. *)

  427. val get_int8 : string -> int -> int
  428. (** [get_int8 b i] is [b]'s signed 8-bit integer starting at character
  429.     index [i].

  431.     @since 4.13
  432. *)

  434. val get_uint16_ne : string -> int -> int
  435. (** [get_uint16_ne b i] is [b]'s native-endian unsigned 16-bit integer
  436.     starting at character index [i].

  438.     @since 4.13
  439. *)

  441. val get_uint16_be : string -> int -> int
  442. (** [get_uint16_be b i] is [b]'s big-endian unsigned 16-bit integer
  443.     starting at character index [i].

  445.     @since 4.13
  446. *)

  448. val get_uint16_le : string -> int -> int
  449. (** [get_uint16_le b i] is [b]'s little-endian unsigned 16-bit integer
  450.     starting at character index [i].

  452.     @since 4.13
  453. *)

  455. val get_int16_ne : string -> int -> int
  456. (** [get_int16_ne b i] is [b]'s native-endian signed 16-bit integer
  457.     starting at character index [i].

  459.     @since 4.13
  460. *)

  462. val get_int16_be : string -> int -> int
  463. (** [get_int16_be b i] is [b]'s big-endian signed 16-bit integer
  464.     starting at character index [i].

  466.     @since 4.13
  467. *)

  469. val get_int16_le : string -> int -> int
  470. (** [get_int16_le b i] is [b]'s little-endian signed 16-bit integer
  471.     starting at character index [i].

  473.     @since 4.13
  474. *)

  476. val get_int32_ne : string -> int -> int32
  477. (** [get_int32_ne b i] is [b]'s native-endian 32-bit integer
  478.     starting at character index [i].

  480.     @since 4.13
  481. *)

  483. val hash : t -> int
  484. (** An unseeded hash function for strings, with the same output value as
  485.     {!Hashtbl.hash}. This function allows this module to be passed as argument
  486.     to the functor {!Hashtbl.Make}.

  488.     @since 5.0 *)

  490. val seeded_hash : int -> t -> int
  491. (** A seeded hash function for strings, with the same output value as
  492.     {!Hashtbl.seeded_hash}. This function allows this module to be passed as
  493.     argument to the functor {!Hashtbl.MakeSeeded}.

  495.     @since 5.0 *)

  497. val get_int32_be : string -> int -> int32
  498. (** [get_int32_be b i] is [b]'s big-endian 32-bit integer
  499.     starting at character index [i].

  501.     @since 4.13
  502. *)

  504. val get_int32_le : string -> int -> int32
  505. (** [get_int32_le b i] is [b]'s little-endian 32-bit integer
  506.     starting at character index [i].

  508.     @since 4.13
  509. *)

  511. val get_int64_ne : string -> int -> int64
  512. (** [get_int64_ne b i] is [b]'s native-endian 64-bit integer
  513.     starting at character index [i].

  515.     @since 4.13
  516. *)

  518. val get_int64_be : string -> int -> int64
  519. (** [get_int64_be b i] is [b]'s big-endian 64-bit integer
  520.     starting at character index [i].

  522.     @since 4.13
  523. *)

  525. val get_int64_le : string -> int -> int64
  526. (** [get_int64_le b i] is [b]'s little-endian 64-bit integer
  527.     starting at character index [i].

  529.     @since 4.13
  530. *)

  532. (**/**)

  534. (* The following is for system use only. Do not call directly. *)

  536. external unsafe_get : string -> int -> char = "%string_unsafe_get"
  537. external unsafe_blit :
  538.   src:string -> src_pos:int -> dst:bytes -> dst_pos:int -> len:int ->
  539.     unit = "caml_blit_string" [@@noalloc]
